subject: Management
title: Feedback Across Power Gaps
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Feedback Across Power Gaps.

hook.text: An intern spotted a flaw in the director's plan but said nothing. Three months of wasted work followed.

buildup.text: Power differences make upward feedback terrifying. The risk feels one-sided.

discovery.text: Leaders who actively solicit upward feedback get better information and make better decisions.

twist.text: The higher you climb, the less honest feedback you receive. You have to work harder to get it.

climax.text: Create safe channels: anonymous surveys, skip-levels, and explicit invitations to disagree.

punchline.text: Power silences truth. Leaders must fight for honesty.

quiz.question: Why is upward feedback so rare in organizations?
options: Power differences make giving feedback to leaders feel risky
Junior employees have nothing valuable to contribute
Leaders already know everything they need to improve on
